storyInfo: A mechanical voice and an impassive expression conceal Ptilopsis's unfathomable secrets.

attributes.content: All of this information is consistent with our hypothesis.
With these data on hand, Rhine Lab's newest results now directly correlate with the ancient Sarkaz legend. I don't think this is an accident.
And if our hypothesis is verified, it will revolutionize everything we know about Originium.
People think that Originium is a source of energy, a calamity; They think it can be used as a weapon, with only narrow applications outside of that. But the truth may be something far greater.

If Originium really 'stores information,' just think about what that implies. From Originium, we will be able to read the story of this world, spanning hundreds or thousands of years, maybe even more...
Does this really not pique your curiosity?
I've read all your previous reports already, and agree with your conjecture.
attributes.name: Joyce

attributes.content: But how can I help you?
attributes.name: Joyce

attributes.content: You're on board then? That's great news... Thank you so much.
My plan is a bold one...
June 18th, clear skies
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: I fell asleep in the cafeteria today. Gummy was worried about me.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Dr. Silence reminded me that my 'narcolepsy' has gotten worse this month.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: There are more details in my physical examination report.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: The conclusion of the physical: 'Fatigue caused by long-term sleep quality issues.'
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Dr. Silence said that this was caused by the chip in my brain – Device #9.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: I am aware of these things. I know my own problems much better than those who worry about me, but I still must accept their concern.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Dr. Silence has advised me to get more rest, which is a measure that I agree with. But what should I do while resting?
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Please continue deploying your pieces.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Ah, there's no need for that.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: This round... is my loss.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Hoo, now that's a rare sight. When's the last time you threw in the towel?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I must say... it was a rather long time ago.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: According to the records dating from three hours ago, the current score is one to two.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: In accordance with the best-of-three format, your two wins still makes you the victor of today's match, Rangers.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Gwahaha...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Ahaha... I suppose that's your way of letting this old man keep some of his dignity.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: No towel visible. Unable to interpret the underlying meaning of this statement.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Girl, you asked me to teach you how to play chess, and I taught you for twenty minutes.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: We played just three games after that. And in the span of those three games, I'm already convinced I can't win anymore.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: That's what it means to throw in the towel.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Understood. Logging of idiom confirmed.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: By the way, Ptilopsis, why'd you suddenly decide to pick up chess? You don't have much free time, right?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hasn't it been pretty busy in Medical lately?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Dr. Silence's recommendation. Acquire more hobbies to distract myself.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: So you chose chess?
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: And is this really the first time you've played one of these games? You learned way too fast.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Welp, I was thinking I'd want to play a round or two with you, but let's scrap that idea.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yes, this is my first contact with board games of this type.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Previously, I learned to play different kinds of card and board games from other operators.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Most game sessions were very short in duration.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I can already guess what happened. They probably all got trounced by the little lady here...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I'm not surprised though. Medical is full of bright operators, very accomplished in healing Arts. Chess is probably nothing compared to that stuff.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: If you want more of a challenge, why not try the Doctor? That one's pretty well-versed in all kinds of chess variants. Mighty skilled to boot.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: You'll be waiting around for a long time then... The Doctor would split into three pieces to work that much harder, if it was possible.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Ah, a blunder on my part.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Rangers, will we be concluding today's chess session?
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: What time is it?
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Lemme see... Where's my watch?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: 4:35 in the afternoon. There are three hours until Rangers's scheduled duty. In other words, there are still three hours left until work.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: It's fine, we have plenty of time. Let's have another match then.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: However, one can infer that Rangers may have additional work arrangements today.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Based on the data provided by the Catastrophe Messenger and the Originium particulate matter detection data from the past ten days, one can determine that Rhodes Island may move ahead of schedule today to avoid a potential Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: At that time, it may be necessary to mobilize defenders in advance.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I've heard the news, same as you, but the Doctor should still be talking things over with the others––
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: Attention, all Rhodes Island personnel. Attention, all Rhodes Island personnel.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: In two hours' time, Rhodes Island will conduct evasive maneuvers to avoid a Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Requesting all personnel inside the ship prepare for the maneuver in advance, in accordance with the staff manual.
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Hahaha, guess you were right. That settles it for today's game of chess, then. This old man's got work to do.
attributes.name: Rangers

attributes.content: You amaze me sometimes, Ptilopsis. Just how do you do it...?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Don't worry about it, just mumbling to myself. It'd be too rude to ask anyway.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: June 22nd, clear skies
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: I went to see Mayer today to carry out some checks on the operation of Device #9 that I cannot carry out myself.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Mayer brought up a troubling possibility. I've thought about it before, and have my own expectations.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: In other words, Device #9 has placed an enormous burden on my brain, and while this strain has not increased, my ability to withstand its impact cannot continue at its current level indefinitely.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Della was a genius. Her accomplishments –– even if flawed –– must be protected.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Device #9 does have a negative impact on me, and there's also the possibility of it malfunctioning. But had it not stabilized my prior brain disorders, I would not have had the opportunity to express these assessments.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Furthermore, Della's invention also brought me many functional improvements. Some of these were expected even before the experiment, while others exceeded expectations.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: I can see the flow of Originium particles in the human body, and upon this, my understanding and control of medical Originium Arts have strengthened astoundingly.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: At the time, Della believed that not only was this due to a significant increase in the computational capacity of my brain, but also because of that, I was able to unlock a portion of Originium's functionality as an information pathway.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: That is what Device #9 is.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Of course, it can have other uses... It can be used as a weapon. It can save people, and it can also bring destruction. Just like Originium itself, except more intuitive to use.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: This is not the outcome that Della wanted.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Gimme a sec... Let's take a look...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: The voltage is stable, and there's nothing wrong with the receiver...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I don't see any problems. Device #9 is working just fine.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Are there any changes in the part that sends requests to read data?
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Hrmm....
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Unfortunately, nope.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Are you absolutely positive that Device #9 can output data?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: That was the designer's original purpose for this device.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: But even after all this time, I still haven't gotten any meaningful data out of it.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: And be honest with me here. You've gotta feel pretty uncomfortable with a chip inside your head, right?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Even the transmission of electronic signals will affect your body to some extent, right? I try to be real careful when remote-controlling my equipment.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: So far, there have been no side effects that influence physiological indicators.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Miss Dellareed really was something else... This project didn't even have the Engineering's blessing. It really is a transcendent invention.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I'm really curious about how this thing was made! Would you happen to have any kind of reference materials? Diagrams, spare parts, anything?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Negative. There are no backups for Device #9.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Ahh, what a shame.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But... Joyce...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: All machines are bound to have a service life.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Device #9's design is way too complicated, and I don't just mean the chip itself.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: It's connected to your cerebellum and interacts with a large number of neurons in your brain.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: A single point of failure in any part of the entire system will have catastrophic consequences.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I don't know what you and Miss Dellareed were thinking, but... even for Rhine Lab, this is seriously dangerous.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: ...Biological structures...
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I know what you're trying to say.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: 'Biological structures, in essence, are sets of reasonably-working precise machines.' Right?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Seems like something those powdered wigs in Engineering would say.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: But you've gotta face up to a very real problem.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: If one day, Device #9 starts to malfunction, or just stops working altogether, what are you gonna do?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: I haven't seen the whole report, but Silence said something about Device #9 being necessary to keep you alive.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Regular physical examination is necessary.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: This isn't something that physical exams are gonna solve. It's a matter of life or death for you!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Acknowledged.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Maybe I shouldn't be the one saying this but... you should really...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: You really aren't going to ask Rhodes Island for help?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Why don't you go see Closure? She's the most extraordinary engineer I've met in all my years.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Thank you for your concern, Mayer.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: This question will be revisited pending future considerations.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Sigh...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Another deep dream.
In the dream, Joyce stands in a patch of dense fog, with a soft whispering in her ear.
She cannot understand what is being whispered. It is in a language she has never heard before.
It is almost inaudible, seemingly coming from a very distant place.
She wanders through the fog and continues to dream.
Light seems to filter in from a distance, piercing the fog and illuminating the surroundings.
She sees a large Originium crystal that gives off a peculiar glow.
Hm...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: So far, all your key physiological indicators are normal.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: But the quality of your sleep is still poor. Are you still having those dreams through the whole night?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: That's not a good sign. You've been in this state for too long.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The physiological indicators are not abnormal.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Current physiological indicators can never be used to rule out problems, and you should be well aware of that. If you are unable to rest, it will become life-threatening, in the long run.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Maybe we should consult Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I'm sure she knows some way of relieving your mental burden.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Rejected. Device #9 is a confidential Rhine Lab experimental project.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: They might not even care about that project anymore.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Miss Dellareed's team has long been disbanded.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You might be... No, you are the only legacy of the Device #9 project.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Dr. Silence, do you believe in that saying?
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: To which saying are you referring?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: 'Originium stores the story of this world, spanning hundreds or thousands of years, maybe even more.'
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: When I was with Rhine Lab, I didn't actually understand Miss Dellareed's project...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I can't answer that question. It's outside the scope of my expertise.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: But the feedback data I've gotten from the monitor suggests your dreams are a side effect of Device #9.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: It might be reconstructing fragments of information you received when awake, and then playing them back repeatedly during your sleep.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: This 'playback' is one of the side effects of Device #9, in the same vein as the strong logical thinking it has brought you.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Device #9 forces your brain to stay in a continuously stimulated state, which is also the source of your poor sleep quality as well as your 'narcolepsy.'
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: As you know, Miss Dellareed's project was also full of holes. Most of the fundamental stipulations were built upon conjectures, and lacked evidentiary support.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: The basic principles of the experiment lacked solid ground, but they still had Miss Dellareed carry out that experiment. That's why you became what you are now.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Internally at Rhine Lab, the experiment was considered a failure, and that led you to...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Objection. Erroneous account of events.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Della is not responsible for the lack of critical information in passing down that judgment.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I wasn't accusing Dellareed of...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Della? Is that what you called her?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I know that Miss Dellareed was your friend.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Her death... had nothing to do with you. I don't have any right to blame her, but that tragedy was brought about by her obsession with her research.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I've seen... far too many tragedies like that in Rhine Lab.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Well, if it really is because of Miss Dellareed, I'm willing to have a chat with you. I'm sure Mayer would too.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: But I wouldn't fixate too much on that saying.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: And don't always bottle things up either.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Staying in a prolonged state of mental agitation won't do any favors for your health.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Right now, you are my assistant, as well as my friend. And as a friend...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I hope that you can live a better life.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Sorry for worrying you, Dr. Silence.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Re-registering relationship status with Dr. Silence––
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: ––Friend.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: If you're in a good enough mood to be cracking jokes, I probably don't have anything to worry about.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Having that said, I'll be heading out to do some field work with Dr. Kal'tsit next week. I'm not comfortable leaving you alone in your current state.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: In other words, if you encounter any abnormalities of any kind on the way back, you must be sure to let me know.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Thank you, Dr. Silence.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Oh right, if it's not too much trouble, I'm going to ask you to take this medicine back to Ifrit.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I might run a bit late tonight.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: No problem, Dr. Silence.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: I'm bored! When is Silence getting here?
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: She's real busy today, so I came in her place.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Boo... I thought I wouldn't have to do my homework if Silence wasn't coming around.
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: You lazy bum. You'd better watch yourself or Silence will make you sit down with the Doctor 'til you finish all your homework.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Naw, you ain't fooling me with that. The Doctor's even busier than Silence. Swung by the office a couple times, and nobody was there.
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: That is true...
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Oh, it's Silence!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Negative.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: It's Joyce!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Is Silence working overtime again?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: This is Ifrit's medicine.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Yuck... It's the bitter kind again...
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Go set it over there. I'll put it away later.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: This is a snack for Ifrit.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Woohoo! You're the best, Joyce!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Hold up! No snacks 'til you're done with your homework!
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Fine, fine, I'm doing it!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: I got 70 points on my test today too!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Hard work begets success. Please keep it up.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: You only got a 70, and I didn't even bust out any hard questions. Better step up your game, Ifrit.
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Whatever...
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Oh, by the way...
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Why are you in such a good mood today, Joyce?
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Some positive developments occurred. But not to the extent of necessitating a display of mood swings.
attributes.name: Ptilopsis

attributes.content: Wait a sec, Ifrit, how'd you know that Joyce was in a good mood?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: Huh? Isn't it obvious? When she's happy, her eyebrows go up a little bit, her forehead is more relaxed, and the corners of her mouth change too.
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: How'd you figure that out?
attributes.name: Mayer

attributes.content: It's just something you get used to!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: June 23rd, cloudy
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Dr. Silence told me that I am her friend. I am very thankful to her.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Dr. Silence is a good person, but because of that, I don't want to make her life harder.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: She already carries too many burdens.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Such as Ifrit's 'Diαbolic Crisis.' And the other problems she and Saria have to face.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: But... if my fate is already sealed...
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: I hope Dr. Silence and Ifrit will have happy endings.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: My problems are very different from theirs, but they probably all stem from Rhine Lab's experiments.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: There are a lot of people like us at Rhine Lab.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: Outsiders think Columbian scientific research involves a lot of human experimentation.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: But that statement needs an addendum to be accurate. Many researchers are far too eager to carry out these experiments on themselves.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: ...and only a tiny number of them have happy endings.
attributes.name: Diary

attributes.content: A dream––
Joyce's dream is full of hallucinations and whispers, an illusory world full of things she does not understand.
She treks through these lengthy dreams day after day, and even if she doesn't understand them, these scenes have already become commonplace.
However, during this brief moment, she suddenly realizes that the dreamscape is becoming clearer.
The wending whispers by her ear turn to recognizable words and sentences.
The mist obscuring her vision is slowly dissipating as well.
She stands atop a lofty mountain, and gazes down at everything before her.
In front of her, a magnificent city collapses into a dazzling display of metallic dust. Towering steel structures melt like clay.
In front of her, the shadow of a terrible colossus floats in the clouds above, the writhing darkness blotting out the sun and enveloping all.
In front of her, anguished screams and desperate cries waft up from the city.
Behind her, the Originium crystal shines with a peculiar glow.
